meanings.definition: To evolve into a new species.
meanings.sent1: The birds speciated over time, becoming different types of finches.
meanings.sent2: The fish speciated due to changes in their environment, leading to the development of new species.
meanings.sent3: The scientist joked that the aliens might speciate into a new intergalactic species.
meanings.sent4: The idea of humans one day speciating into a species with wings is a fascinating concept.
meanings.sent5: The concept of speciating can be seen in the diverse range of plant species in the rainforest.

meanings.definition: To cause to evolve into a new species.
meanings.sent1: The environmental changes speciated the insects, resulting in the emergence of new species.
meanings.sent2: The isolation of a group of animals can speciate them over generations.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist tried to speciate the bacteria in his lab as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The introduction of a new predator can speciate the prey population, leading to evolutionary changes.
meanings.sent5: The process of speciating can be influenced by various factors in nature.
